repairer had secured his own insurance policy for liability which he may incur in the course of his work. negligence

respondent provided the repairer with invoices bearing the respondent's name for the repairer to give to customers upon completion of work

repairer authorised to receive payments from customers on behalf of the respondent

consideration of the approach to damages

citances.sentence: In the same place, even more succinctly but to proper effect Ms Olsson said that these were not `Harry Seidler houses or [by] Mies van der Rohe. ' [159] [2005] FCA 1238 ; (2006) 66 IPR 554. See also Autodesk Australia Pty Ltd v Cheung (1990) 17 IPR 69 (Wilcox J), Gaunt v Hille [2007] FCA 2017 ; (2008) 75 IPR 33 , and Greenwood J's judgment in AV Jennings Ltd v Bogdan (2009) 80 IPR 356. [160] See Tolmark v Paul 46 IPR at [62] --- [64]. This calculation by his Honour was on the basis of the "licence fee" approach to which I have referred.

It follows that applying a licence fee in the present circumstances is an inappropriate measure of damages. Thus, damages should be assessed on the footing that damages are, in this case, at large ( Fenning Film Service Limited v Wolverhampton, Walsall and District Cinemas Limited [1914] 3 KB 1171 ; Gaunt v Hille [2007] FCA 2017 at 75 - 79).
